snippet: Founded in 1999, the publishing arm of The New York Review of Books has reissued everything from ancient Chinese poems to a never-released Chekhov story collection to the literary sleeper “Stoner.”
abstract: New York Review of Books releases The Prank, Anton Chekhov short story collection from 1882; works, which were sitting in archive and never before published, are latest print project by New York Review, retriever of overlooked or disregarded writings often deemed too risky for print by larger publishers.
lead_paragraph: Founded in 1999, the publishing arm of The New York Review of Books has reissued everything from ancient Chinese poems to a never-released Chekhov story collection to the literary sleeper “Stoner.”

headline.main: New York Review of Books Fills a Niche by Reviving Forgotten Works
headline.print_headline: A Publisher as Salvager of Bygone Delights
